Billions Network has launched a refreshed website at https://t.co/jP37iIbTww 

The site really nails what the project stands for: same mission,same principles,but now with a cleaner, faster and more refined experience. Everything about it feels more cohesive and intentional.

Itâ€™s great to see how theyâ€™ve kept their privacy-first and AI accountability values front and center while improving the overall usability and design. The new site not only looks better, it communicates trust and clarity, exactly whatâ€™s needed when youâ€™re building bridges between humans and AI agents.

Overall, itâ€™s a strong upgrade that shows @billions_ntwk is evolving without losing sight of what makes it authentic: transparency, community, and real-world purpose.

Just caught this SonyBank nailed a pilot with SettleMint using @billions_ntwk zero-knowledge KYC now they can verify customers without ever touching or storing sensitive personal data 

That means lower breach risk, cheaper compliance, way faster onboarding (and reusable across services), plus real privacy that customers actually want and it's already been tested with HSBC and Deutsche Bank, and with millions of verifications done, this isn't just hype

With tougher data rules coming and Sony prepping its USD stablecoin for 2026 (think smoother payments in gaming and entertainment), zkKYC feels like the perfect bridge between traditional banking and Web3. Honestly, this is the kind of practical tech that's going to make banking safer and more efficient for everyone. 
Good stuff!

If even big banks can now perform KYC without snooping on customer data, it means that the old paradigm is outdated.

Sony Bank in Japan has just proven it : using zero-knowledge proof technology from @billions_ntwk , they verify customer identities without storing their personal data.
Everything remains secure on the customer's device.

This isn't just theory. It's live. And it's the answer for the future: privacy and legal compliance can go hand in hand.

The winners will be the institutions that respect privacy, not those that treat customer data as a liability.

Sony Bank in Japan has adopted @billions_ntwkâ€™s zero-knowledge verification, allowing identity checks without storing customer data. The Death of Old-School KYC. ğŸ’€

Traditional KYC is a "Centralized Bomb." Itâ€™s a honeypot for hackers and a nightmare for your privacy. Itâ€™s time to move to the DeepTrust Protocol.

How Billions Network changes the game:
- ZKP over Storage: We use math, not databases. You verify locally; we confirm on-chain.

- Selective Disclosure: Prove you are "18+" or a "Verified Citizen" without revealing your name.

- The $BILL Advantage: A single, private identity that earns you trust scores and airdrops across the entire Web3 ecosystem.

Privacy is not a feature. Itâ€™s a human right.
